      • CenterAnyJFrame

        public static void CenterAnyJFrame(javax.swing.JFrame thisFrame)
        This method centers the login window and any window that would be using or calling the method
        Parameters:
        thisFrame -

      • CloseAnyJFrame

        public static void CloseAnyJFrame(java.lang.Object thisFrame)

        Method Description

        This method closes the present window when called and provided with an object of type JFrame. One has to set the default close operation to DISPOSE_ON_CLOSE (as shown in the code snippet) so that the closing of the applied JFrame object does not quit or exit the application as a whole

        Code Snippet

         
 setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.DISPOSE_ON_CLOSE);
 OR
 jframe.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.DISPOSE_ON_CLOSE);
        Parameters:
        thisFrame -

      • setLookAndFeelOfUI

        public static void setLookAndFeelOfUI()
        This method helps to change the default look and feel of the Eclipse windowBuilder controls. It does that by making use of the UIManager.

      • showMessageBox

        public static void showMessageBox(java.lang.String message,
                                  java.lang.String title,
                                  int type)
        This method makes use of the JOption class and the calls its showMessageDialog method to show message to users when a specific activity occurs. It has three parameters which are the
        • Message
        • Message Title
        • Type of Message
        The type of message are accepted as integers as the following;
        1. ERROR_MESSAGE,
        2. INFORMATION_MESSAGE,
        3. WARNING_MESSAGE,
        4. QUESTION_MESSAGE, or
        5. PLAIN_MESSAGE
        Parameters:
        message - A message to show to users. e.g. Invalid Username or password entered
        title - e.g. Authentication Failed
        type - e.g. 2 (for information)
